title: Deploying doccano using one-click deployment on heroku results in receiving error
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Deploying doccano using one-click deployment on heroku I receive an error. After setting up the required config vars, the app boots up with failure. The apps logs the following: 

`2022-06-27T08:47:00.515478+00:00 heroku[web.1]: Process exited with status 1
2022-06-27T08:47:00.856947+00:00 heroku[web.1]: State changed from starting to crashed
2022-06-27T08:47:00.859827+00:00 heroku[web.1]: State changed from crashed to starting
2022-06-27T08:47:12.416978+00:00 heroku[web.1]: Starting process with command `/bin/sh -c /doccano/tools/run.sh`
2022-06-27T08:47:13.504367+00:00 app[web.1]: Missing ADMIN_USERNAME environment variable
2022-06-27T08:47:13.636059+00:00 heroku[web.1]: Process exited with status 1
2022-06-27T08:47:13.743087+00:00 heroku[web.1]: State changed from starting to crashed
2022-06-27T08:47:16.286626+00:00 heroku[router]: at=error code=H10 desc="App crashed" method=GET path="/" host=the-connectionists.herokuapp.com request_id=cada9803-3937-49b0-b80c-d60d9ab23df2 fwd="77.21.243.125" dyno= connect= service= status=503 bytes= protocol=https
2022-06-27T08:47:24.180241+00:00 heroku[router]: at=error code=H10 desc="App crashed" method=GET path="/" host=the-connectionists.herokuapp.com request_id=b67dc2f1-2030-45cf-8dcf-47cf910c225a fwd="77.21.243.125" dyno= connect= service= status=503 bytes= protocol=https`

Although it seems like the ADMIN_USERNAME is missing, I set it before in the setup page. Is there anything still need to be set?
